title: Pipeline Integrity Digs
description: BiFrost Industrial Services spent three weeks identifying and addressing weak spots in a vital underground pipeline. Using our hydrovacs and combo vacs, we performed multiple integrity digs, exposing critical sections with precision. Despite challenging terrain and tight deadlines, the project was completed safely and efficiently, minimizing disruption to surrounding areas.
challengesFaced: Difficult terrain and tight project deadlines.
outcome: Zero incidents and completed 2 days ahead of schedule.
photoDescription: A hydrovac performing pipeline integrity digs near Consort, Alberta.
testimonial: BiFrost's precision was unmatched. Highly recommended! - Peter S., Project Lead

title: Oil Tank Overfill Cleanup
description: Following a sensor failure, a tank at an oil battery near Youngstown overflowed by approximately 200 m³, breaching the containment berm. BiFrost spent three weeks mitigating the spill, removing contaminated soil, and ensuring compliance with environmental standards. Our team worked closely with environmental consultants to restore the site to its original state.
challengesFaced: Environmental concerns and contaminated soil management.
outcome: Site restored to compliance and environmental standards.
environmentalImpact: Full restoration with eco-friendly disposal methods.
photoDescription: BiFrost team cleaning up an oil spill at a battery near Youngstown, Alberta.
testimonial: The cleanup was thorough and efficient. Excellent work! - Brad L., Environmental Consultant

title: New Pipeline Installation
location: Red Deer, Lacombe, and Sylvan Lake, Alberta
description: Throughout 2024, BiFrost supported the installation of new pipelines connecting Red Deer, Lacombe, and Sylvan Lake. Our team provided hydrovac and combo vac services for several Horizontal Directional Drills (HDDs) under major highways and roads. We also collaborated with subcontractors, ensuring safe handling of utilities and efficient project execution.
challengesFaced: Managing subcontractors and ensuring coordination across multiple sites.
outcome: Pipelines installed on schedule with minimal utility disruption.
environmentalImpact: Complied with environmental guidelines for excavation near sensitive areas.
photoDescription: BiFrost team supporting pipeline installation HDDs near Highway 11.
testimonial: Great teamwork and coordination across a complex project! - Adam H., Project Supervisor

title: Facility Expansion
description: BiFrost supported a plant expansion where new power and data lines were being added to an operational facility. Due to existing utilities, traditional digging methods were not feasible. Our hydrovac team covered over 1,200 meters in three weeks, delivering precise excavation while preserving surrounding infrastructure.
challengesFaced: Dense web of existing utilities requiring precision excavation.
outcome: Completed on time with zero utility disruptions.
photoDescription: Hydrovac operations for facility expansion in Macklin, Saskatchewan.
testimonial: Their precision was critical to the project’s success. - Michael R., Project Manager

title: Light Post Replacement
description: BiFrost replaced 75 light posts over a three-month period in Wainwright. Using our hydrovacs, we ensured precise and safe excavation near existing utilities, minimizing disruptions to the community.
challengesFaced: Working in urban areas with high traffic and existing infrastructure.
outcome: All light posts replaced on schedule with minimal community disruption.
environmentalImpact: Eco-friendly disposal of debris and minimal soil disturbance.
photoDescription: BiFrost hydrovac team replacing light posts in Wainwright, Alberta.
testimonial: BiFrost handled the project professionally and efficiently. - Josh T., City Planner
